doc.after: Preceding film in origin by thousands of years early plays and dances had elements common to film scripts sets costumes production direction actors audiences storyboards and scores Much terminology later used in film theory and criticism apply such as mise en scene roughly the entire visual picture at any one time Owing to the lack of any technology for doing so the moving images and sounds could not be recorded for replaying as with film
